title: Self-Regulation and Emotional Management Strategies for Foreign Language Learning in Online Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: A course where pre-service teachers learn to support learners' self-regulation and emotional stability in online educational environments

learning_goals: Learners identify and explain three or more self-regulated strategies during online interactions
Learners diagnose anxiety factors in foreign language learning environments and propose mitigation strategies
Learners develop two or more activities that promote learner engagement and enjoyment when designing blended lessons
Learners can analyze the correlation between self-regulation and emotional management and propose strategies for classroom application.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
